intro: Godetia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its broad, lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem. Godetia latifolia is often cultivated as a garden ornamental due to its attractive flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
